name: Sri Lankan Chicken Curry
author: Rick Stein
ingredients: - 2 tbsp coconut or vegetable oil - 1.5 kg chicken, jointed into 8 pieces (or 1kg boneless thighs) - Freshly ground black pepper - 15cm cinnamon stick, broken into pieces - 10 green cardamom pods, bruised - 10 cloves - 350g onions or shalllots, halved and thinly sliced - 40g garlic, crushed - 25g peeled ginger, finely grated - 2 tbsp roasted Sri Lankan curry powder - 1 tsp chilli powder - 1 tsp turmeric - 200g chopped tomatoes, fresh or from a can - 20 fresh curry leaves - 3 green chillies, split lengthways - 400ml coconut milk - 1 tbsp lime juice
instructions:
- Heat the oil in a large, deep heavy-based frying pan. Season the chicken on both sides with salt & pepper, add them to the pan and fry over a medium heat for 5 minutes until golden brown. Lift onto a plate.
- Add the cinnamon, cardamom pods and cloves to the oil left in the pan and leave them to sizzle for a few seconds. Add the onions and fry gently for 5 minutes until soft and lightly browned. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for 2 minutes. Add the roasted curry powder, chilli powder and turmeric and fry for 1 minute more.
- Return the chicken to the pan with the tomatoes, curry leaves, pandan leaf, lemongrass, chillies and 1 tsp salt. Cover and cook gently over a medium-low heat for 25 minutes or until the chicken is tender.
- Uncover, add the coconut milk, cover again and simmer for 5 minutes more. Stir in the lime juice and serve.
